content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Maria Cadeddu, mcadeddu@anl.gov</origin>     <title>Microwave Radiometer - high frequency </title>     <pubdate>20100316</pubdate>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov/instruments/mwrhf </onlink>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov</onlink>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov/instruments</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract> The Microwave Radiometer-High Frequency (MWRHF) provides time-series measurements of brightness temperatures from two channels centered at 90 and 150 GHz. These two channels are sensitive to the presence of liquid water and precipitable water vapor. </abstract>    <supplinf> mwrhf handbook is available at: http//www.arm.gov/publications/tech_reports/handbooks/mwrhf_handbook.pdf</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <rngdates>      <begdate>03NOV2006 </begdate>      <enddate>02JAN2008
